snippet: The world’s first large-scale project to capture the greenhouse gas carbon dioxide from a coal-burning power plant opened on Wednesday in Saskatchewan.
abstract: World's first large-scale project to capture greenhouse gas carbon dioxide from a coal-burning power plant opens at the Boundary Dam plant in Western Canada; project took five years and cost $1.2 billion.
lead_paragraph: The world’s first large-scale project to capture the greenhouse gas carbon dioxide from a coal-burning power plant opened on Wednesday in Saskatchewan.

headline.main: First Carbon Capture Plant Opens in Canada
headline.print_headline: Plant to Capture Carbon Opens in Western Canada
